headline.main: J. Reuben Clark Jr. Dies at 90,Mormon Leader Was Ex-Envoy; Ambassador to Meixco Under Hoover -- Ranked Second Among Church Officials

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 -- Tax collectors from all but three countries of the Western Hemisphere will meet in Buenos Aires next week.The subject of the conference is tax administration -- the work of tax-collecting agencies, as distinguished from tax...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 7 -- Tax collectors from all but three countries of the Western Hemisphere will meet in Buenos Aires next week.The subject of the conference is tax administration -- the work of tax-collecting agencies, as distinguished from tax policy. But officials here are hopeful that the conference, and its resuits, will lay the base for the tax reform contemplated in the new hemispheric Alliance for Progress. The three countries that have

headline.main: TAX AIDES WILL MEET IN AMERICAS SESSION

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5 -- Argentina celebrated Highway Day today as a salute to the paving in the last year of hundreds of miles of much-needed roads.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 5 -- Argentina celebrated Highway Day today as a salute to the paving in the last year of hundreds of miles of much-needed roads.
docs.abstract: Govt celebrates Hwy Day to mark paving of 780 mi of hwys in last 13 mos; 10-yr program to be completed, '69; will provide 12,000 mi of all-weather rds

headline.main: ARGENTINA HAILS IMPROVED ROADS; Presses Highway Program to Aid Isolated Areas

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 7 -- President Kennedy has had a solid impact here and over all has made a very good impression. The editor of La Prensa sums up: "Everybody praises him, even the union leaders speak well of him, and that saying a lot."
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 7 -- President Kennedy has had a solid impact here and over all has made a very good impression. The editor of La Prensa sums up: "Everybody praises him, even the union leaders speak well of him, and that saying a lot."

byline.original: By EDWARD C. BURKS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: British pound sterling moved irregularly on active dealings in the foreign exchange market last week. Canadian dollar was steady and quiet.
docs.lead_paragraph: British pound sterling moved irregularly on active dealings in the foreign exchange market last week. Canadian dollar was steady and quiet.

docs.snippet: A leader of the World Jewish Congress asserted yesterday that "the conscience" of the Latin-American peoples would not permit neo-Nazi groups to instigate any anti-Semitic outbreaks in their countries.
docs.lead_paragraph: A leader of the World Jewish Congress asserted yesterday that "the conscience" of the Latin-American peoples would not permit neo-Nazi groups to instigate any anti-Semitic outbreaks in their countries.
docs.abstract: Dr M Goldman sees neo-Nazis trying to stir bias from time to time but sees Latin Amers rejecting them, int, NYC

headline.main: LATIN PEOPLES FOUND TO REJECT NEO-NAZIS

docs.snippet: Rates for the principal currencies moved narrowly in the foreign exchange market last week. Dealings for the British pound sterling were fairly heavy while trading in the Canadian dollar was light.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rates for the principal currencies moved narrowly in the foreign exchange market last week. Dealings for the British pound sterling were fairly heavy while trading in the Canadian dollar was light.

docs.snippet: Raul Apold, press chief for Juan D. Peron until shortly before the Argentine dictator's fall in September, 1955, was revealed yesterday to have been an executive of Prensa Latina, news agency backed by the Cuban Government.
docs.lead_paragraph: Raul Apold, press chief for Juan D. Peron until shortly before the Argentine dictator's fall in September, 1955, was revealed yesterday to have been an executive of Prensa Latina, news agency backed by the Cuban Government.

headline.main: PERON PRESS AIDE ASSISTED CASTRO; Apold, an Argentine, Was Recently on Cuban Staff

docs.snippet: Adlai E. Stevenson told a Latin-American audience yesterday that "it takes political courage" to carry out the domestic reforms necessary under the Alliance for Progress program proposed by President Kennedy.
